User.title: User
User.description: Represents a user of the VerbalStock application.

id.description: Unique identifier for the user entity.

email.description: The email address of the user.

firstName.description: The first name of the user.

lastName.description: The last name of the user.

InventoryItem.title: InventoryItem
InventoryItem.description: Represents an item in the inventory.

id.description: Unique identifier for the inventory item.

name.description: The name of the inventory item.

description.description: A description of the inventory item.

quantity.description: The quantity of the item in stock.

reorderThreshold.description: The quantity at which a reorder alert should be triggered.

Report.title: Report
Report.description: Represents a generated report for inventory data.

reportType.description: The type of report (e.g., daily sales, stock valuation).

dateGenerated.description: The date and time the report was generated.

data.description: The data contained in the report (e.g., JSON, CSV).

definition.description: Stores user profiles. The `userId` parameter is the Firebase Authentication UID.

params.name: userId
params.description: The unique identifier for the user, corresponding to their Firebase Auth UID.

definition.description: Stores inventory items owned by a specific user. The `userId` parameter matches the item's `userId` field. Path-based ownership ensures only the user can manage these items.

params.name: userId
params.description: The unique identifier for the user who owns this inventory item.

params.name: inventoryItemId
params.description: The unique identifier for the inventory item.

definition.description: Stores reports generated by a specific user. The `userId` parameter matches the report's `userId` field. Path-based ownership ensures only the user can access their reports.

params.name: userId
params.description: The unique identifier for the user who generated this report.

params.name: reportId
params.description: The unique identifier for the report.

firestore.reasoning: The Firestore structure is designed to securely manage user data, inventory items, and reports for the VerbalStock application, prioritizing authorization independence and clear access control. User-owned data is stored under the `/users/{userId}` path, enabling simple and secure ownership-based rules. Inventory items and reports are subcollections under the user, ensuring that only the user can access their respective data. This design removes the need for `get()` calls in the security rules, thus preventing hierarchical authorization dependencies and promoting atomic operations. The chosen structure effectively segregates user data, allowing for precise security rules based on path-based ownership, which simplifies access control and enhances debuggability. QAPs are satisfied by the inherent security model. Each user's data is kept separate, preventing unauthorized access, and the path-based ownership ensures only authenticated users can access their own inventory and reports.
